title: Difference between Ottoman and Mughal Empires

content.prompt: Which of the following accurately describes a significant difference between the Ottoman and Mughal Empires in the early seventeenth century?

choices.label: The Mughals practiced religious tolerance toward non-Muslim subjects, while the Ottomans did not.
The Ottomans ruled over people who were predominately Muslim, while the Mughals did not.
The Mughals used gunpowder weapons to expand their territory, while the Ottomans did not.
The Ottomans made Shia Islam the official state religion, while the Mughals made Buddhism the official state religion.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
